name: Angels by my side
description:
This painting is titled Angels by My Side. It measures 16 x 20 and is painted on a stretched canvas. It was painted with acrylic paints and finished with a fine gloss varnish. It is signed and dated (August 2010) on the back.

About the Painting:
Angels by My Side is a reminder that no matter what you believe in, there is no doubt that Angels watch over us everyday. Especially when we think we are alone.

name: Sunday Morning
description:
This painting is titled Sunday Morning. It measures 16 x 20 and is painted on a stretched canvas. I used acrylic paint and a light gloss varnish. It is signed and dated (September 2010) on the back.

About the Painting:
I came up with the name of this painting "Sunday Morning" because of the energy I felt when I awoke. It was on a Sunday morning, the sun was shinning through my window and I felt an enormous amount of positive energy. I felt as though no mountain was to high to climb and I was open to every opportunity put before me.

name: City Life
description:
This painting is done on a 16 x 20 stretched canvas. I used acrylic paint and a light gloss varnish to finish

About the painting:
This painting is a reminder of the energy in the big city. Loud, constricted, and very busy. At the same time, it's bright, fun and full of life.

name: Total Confustion
description:
I believe everyone who views this painting will be able to identify with its name Total Confusion. One day life is good and everything is put together and the next day with out a warning your whole world gets turned upside down. Not knowing what happen, how it happen or why it happen. Life yesterday is gone in the wind, nothing is making sense, questions surround you, chaos is back and you are left in a state of Total Confusion.

It measures 16 x 20 on a stretched canvas. It was painted with acrylic paint and finished with a gloss varnish. It is signed and dated on the back.

name: Lady Manifestation  "Lady M"
description:
This painting was done on a 16 x 20 stretched canvas. I used acrylic paint and finished with a light gloss varnish.


About the painting:
Lady Manifestation or "Lady M" as I like to call it, is a reminder that if we look inside ourselves with truth, honesty and wisdom, nothing is out of our reach. We have the power and the energy to manifest our deepest desires. When we believe it, we manifest it.
